unit_learning_outcomes.description: Appropriately interpret neuropsychological test results including base rate analysis
Demonstrate knowledge of the key characteristics of neuropsychological disorders, and how to identify these in a clinical setting
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the ways in which acquired brain damage can disrupt cognitive functioning
Demonstrate understanding of the difference between psychological and neuropsychological assessment.

assessments.description: Open book of six short answers questions in 90 minutes

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment Title	Interpretation of neuropsychological test results.
assessments.description: Description In 1750 words, students are required to interpret and analyse test results
In 1750 words students are required to interpret and report on clinical data

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is designed as an introduction to common neuropsychological disorders including disorders of memory, adaptive functions, perception, praxis and language. Models of normal and abnormal function and case examples of dysfunction are presented.This unit is designed to provide insight into how neuropsychological disorders typically manifest. It provides students with an understanding of how functions such as memory, adaptive abilities, perception, praxis and language are typically disrupted as a result of neurological dysfunction. The unit relates to material taught in psychological assessment, professional practice, neuroanatomy and neuropsychopathology.
data.title: Neuropsychological Disorders
